page.title: 13STONEYGATE 1945-85
page.content: { }We asked several people who lived in,or near,the area how it had changed in the last 40 years.There were more large Victorian houses with large gardens and open fields.The land which is now St.John the Baptist School was a farm and clinic.Like today industry,except for a few small businesses,has never been situated in this area.It has always been residential.What kind of transport did you use?Trams were still the most common form and more people walked or cycled than today.What entertainments were nearby?Few entertainments were nearby,hardly anyone had television.So we had to make our own,or listen to the radio.Have the shops changed since 1945?Yes-there were many more smaller local shops, one in nearly every street where you could get most items.
